reviews.review: A piece of art. Many people buy the cheap paintings from the many "art" shops in Bali.The Agung Rai Museum of Art gives you an opportunity to see and touch the real Balinese art and traditions.Set in few pavilions surrounded with a lavish garden, the place is peaceful and relaxing.Most of all we enjoyed the room with the musical instruments and the museum staff were very patient and friendly and allowed us to create our own music.It is a good place to visit while you are in Ubud.
Wonderful place for some reflection. Wonderful museum consisting of two buildings. A nice mixture of pieces. A nice place to stroll and wander while taking some culture in and escaping the heat.

Great museum to see in Ubud. The garden is majestic! It is such a pleasure to discover the Balinese arts in such a setting. I like the way they blend commercial activity and culture in a unique model that should inspire other countries. The resort is open so you can stroll through the beautiful villas and enjoy the rich parc and surroundings. Inside the museum there is plenty to uncover about how Bali became what it is now and about peoples who inspired its development by fostering local artist and creative spirit. I loved it!

Must See attraction in Ubud , just 1 Km away from City Center, next to Monkey Forest Sanctuary. A must see attraction in Ubud, located close to the Monkey Forest Sanctuary, just little more than 1 Km away from City Center ( Ubud Palace). It has 2 sections & offers a chance to view some of the best Balinese artworks. The Entry ticket of 80000 Rp also offers a complimentary Tea/Coffee with a Balinese sweet to savour in their Warung located next to Rice fields. One can enjoy the views of Green Landscape of Ubud from here. Visitors can also visit Antonio Blanco Arts Museum in the City Center, 400 ,meters away from Palace, for another worthwhile attraction in the Arts zone. Also once these are experienced , it is better to avoid the Museum Lukisan as it is not worth the tickets charged & also becoms repeatitive.

Museum & Resort combo. We have stayed in the attached resort, which gives you free access to the museum and the benefit of the lush Balinese gardens and rice paddies stretching over several ha. Balinese Dance Shows are also organized almost nightly on site and there is also an excellent (modern) Thai Restaurant.

Good collection of Indonesian history and art. the place is pretty big and had some sections to explore. The small collection of modern art is good. The meat of the collection is in its Balinese collection though. Very detailed. If i had more time i would have stayed for the stage performances. Good attraction.

Comprehensive collection of art. Wide variety of paintings from last century, showcasing local and visiting artists. Nicely presented and displayed over several buildings. Be sure to check out the gardens too.

Very pleased with this museum - surprised it doesn't have more visitors. We visited this museum which is just past one of the palaces in Ubud. It's a beautiful complex with 4 building. The artwork is very interesting and a wide variety of artistic styles, periods, etc. It was one of my favorite stops in Ubud.
Just facinating. The decadence of the building, the wild life, and of course the art, you can only imagine living there in the age.

impressive. many pictures of local artist this museum is a must for Ubud visitors the garden is also nice for a walk. The restaurant is superexpensive but some like to dine out on nice tables will find good service

Nice Little Museum with Beautiful Grounds to walk around.. Very nice art collection from private collection of Balinese artists. Some old, some new, all typically Balinese in colour and style. The grounds are beautiful and well kept and well worth the walk around.

So much to offer. The grounds are beautiful to walk. We visited the cafe, the shop, and the Indonesian art museum. All worth it. Beautiful (but pricey) items in the shop, much of the artwork in the museum is stunning.

A wonderful surprise. It was for me a wonderful surprise te ARMA Museum and the gardens. I had the honour and pleasure of a guided visit, of the ARMA museum, by the Mr. Agung Ray himself. The job this man does with this foundation is remarkable and deserves to be supported by everyone visiting Bali. The museum is really a nice surprise with all the paintings where we can see the evolution of balinese paintings through the years. the traditional dances performed by the children and te adults are absolutely remarkable. The garden and all the environment of this Arma foundation is really a must visit place in Bali.

Great display of local art. If you are interested in art - paintings, this is a must see place in Bali. We were not sure what to expect but ended up spending a lot of time here and buying a few art works. The display here is great and the place is very neat and clean.

Rich collection of paintings on display!. The museum, which contain a rich collection of paintings dating all the way back to the 19th century, is made up of 2 main buildings. The works on display were painted by both local and foreign artists, thereby offering us a view of the lens which they looked at life in Bali (and the world). Perhaps reflecting the importance of religion to Balinese, many paintings have a spiritual connotation to them while the more recent artists make use of their work to reflect on life/impact of tourism on modern Bali. And yes, the museum has a cafe and the entrance ticket of RP 80,000 per person comes with one complimentary free drink at the cafe. There is also a rice field at the back of the museum. Overall, this is a nice place with aplenty of activities to spend the day. I certainly enjoyed this visit more than walking senselessly along the endless rows of shops in Ubud selling more or less the same things.

Nice Museum and Surroundings. It's a good place to spend few hours, environment is relaxing, you don't feel rushed and not many tourist there.Museum has some interesting collections and take time to read and see it. There are 3 buildings and surrounding is very nice, typical Balinese environment.Also, ARMA is a good hidden surprise, your ticket includes free tea or coffee and they give you complimentary pancakes also. We didn't had time to have lunch there, would love to.A must see while in Ubud.

Something for Everyone. I visited ARMA with my two kids (ages 7 and 9) and we all enjoyed the museum. Not only are there separate buildings for Balinese, Contemporary and Modern Art, but the grounds of the museum are absolutely beautiful and wonderful for the kids to explore. My kids found something in each building that they enjoyed and they didn't feel like the collection was too overwhelming. The variety of art styles and natural surrounding that we saw were great enough to keep the kids engaged. A free coffee or tea at their lovely cafe is included in the price of the ticket, and it was a perfect finish to our afternoon at the ARMA.
Great museum. I loved this place, you can spend couple of ours wondering around the museums, the surrounding gardens, have refreshments at the back of this wonderful place.

Worth the price. For 80000 you get to see many(not a lot) art, walk around their villa and enjoy a free cup of coffee or tea there's a chair and gazebo for you to rest and chill. I came at around 2 finish at 5 definitely money well spend, the sad thing is when I'm exiting their staff told me there is barong dance at 6 want to go but I already miss my lunch not gonna miss my dinner too.

Deceiving description, not modern art. We came here in the hopes of seeing modern Balinese art, but everything was very traditional and old looking. Half of the museum is spent on a "marketing" exhibit where they talk about the CEOs or founders of major US companies, such as Amazon, Facebook, Google, etc. This wasn't art, but more a printed out Wikipedia page next to their photo. Maybe we were thinking "modern" had a different definition, but this was not our favorite Ubud memory. On the bright side, the free lemonade that came with the ticket was great.

A great personal collection of Balinese art work. If you're into art you will love this place. We spent a good couple of hours looking at the artwork then strolled through the grounds of the Resort which is located in the grounds. The entry fee includes a complimentary cold or hot drink at the Cafe. All in all a nice afternoon.

Stunning scenery and beautiful art pieces. Can't recommend highly enough, probably the best attraction visited in Ubud. Some really beautiful art pieces and well curated collections that bring to life the richness of Balinese and Indonesian culture - there are traditional sections as well as contemporary.Definitely allow yourself an extra hour to explore the beautiful grounds, full of stunning plants and flowers, fruit trees, ponds and a flowing river. The 80k entrance fee is well worth it, especially as it includes a voucher for a free tea/coffee at the cafe.
Beautiful garden and amazing art. A must see if you are in Ubud. Massive private collection of art, and the gallery and garden itself has a fascinating history
Amazing place!. Amazing setting, wonderful museum with beautiful gardens. We spent half a day walking around and it really was a great half day :-)
Local art presented in gorgeous sorroudings.. A space for grown ups. No fun for little people. Very clever artists who do it for the telling of the story not just the dollar.

Unexpected Gem!. Just hopped in to this place to see some art and we are stunned to see such a hidden gem. With everything designed to detail, no one will be disappointed after a stroll inside this. The entrance fee of Rp. 80k includes tea or coffee so you can enjoy a delicious iced tea at the end. Highly recommended for both lovers of art and nature..

Totally worth to visit. The hospitality of the staff is no doubt. Good description of the collections in the museum by the staff. We can see dance, painting and sculpting activities directly while strolling around in the museum. You can also walk through the rice field and enjoy the rice field view. So many awesome painting collection that I can't hardly find in the other museum in Bali. This museum totally worth to visit.

Wonderful Balinese cultural experience!. Our group of 8 participated in a market tour and cooking class as well as batik class. What a fabulous experience! The traditional cooking experience was a blast and the food was terrific! Batik was easier than expected and we all went home with beautiful works of art. Highly recommended.

Great collection of Balinese Art and Culture. The Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA) is more than a museum. It's also a centre for visual and performing arts. When we visited they were just getting ready for the Ubud Jazz Festival. The ARMA has a collection of paintings, special temporary exhibitions, theatre performances, dance, music and painting classes, as well as cultural Workshops.It opens daily from 9am to 6pm. Entrance for adults is $8 which includes a complimentary tea at the Kafe ARMA.The museum is made up of a series of buildings, designed in Balinese style and getting G round them can be a bit tricky as the signage is scanty.They also have a souvenir shop with the lovely Balinese silk and batiks. Do indulge yourself here...
Lovely Place. Beautiful grounds. A wonderful much-needed respite from the tourist crowds in Ubud. The artwork is beautifully displayed.

Used to be great but has lacked investment in recent years. We loved the museum as it is one of the few places in Ubud where you can get a sense for the history and the history of the local art. However, it shines through that there has been a lack of investment since its founding in the 1990s. The museum could do with a better layout of its art collection (e.g. Chronologically) and better descriptions of the eras and art works
Best Museum in Bali. Great selection of art of many different styles and artists. The grounds are also incredible. A must see in Ubud

Has a good historical feel to it. this place was right besides our hotel and we got our tickets and got a complimentary tea or coffee as a really nice resort.the entrance is like a huge stage thing were at time there are some performances and it has a nice old historical feel to it. i am not a very artsy person but i like all the display and it was a nice peaceful place to spend time.

Majestic Art. We went as a family of five, first thought tickets were a bit too much however..As you enter the place is amazing. The architecture , landscape, museum, spa , villas and the restaurant, And of course, the displayed art. Brilliant place.

Great art in amazing buildings and grounds. I thought I would be here for 30 mins but stayed 3 hours. I really enjoyed the art, which explained a lot about balinese culture. The sounds were fantastic. A must to visit when in Ubud

Artistic perspective of Bali. Near the Monkey Forest you'll find this wonderful museum with Agung Rai's art collection depicting Bali's landscapes, culture and art. Among foreign paints, you'll see arts from the region itself. Many things in Bali are similar, this museum brings a fresh sensation and you can leave the region with more than yoga, gastronomy and temples. It gives you an artistic perspective of the religion, culture and landscape, and it is interesting to see the differences in the local paintings - which are stunning. Don't miss the huge modern rice field painting from Made Kedul in the smallest building. It's hidden in an inside room, but it's fantastic. You can also appreciate the calm and beautiful garden, learn about its nature, and see small rice field across the resort which is in the same complex. Don't forget your complimentary coffee or tea on your way out, after all you have paid 80k rp to enter.

One of Two Must-See Art Museums in Ubud. Agung Rai has made an amazing monument to Art here in the Pengosekan part of Ubud. Not only has he displayed his own collection of Balinese and Indonesian paintings, but he has started dance and gamelan classes to make sure the local community has a sense of "ownership" and "belonging". The architecture and grounds are great, and there is a restaurant (Cafe Arma) at the main road. Agung Rai's life has been well spent creating a fortune in art and making it available to all the world in this Museum. The other museum you need to see is the Neka in Sangginggan.

Keeping the Balinese culture alive. This is an amazing place. It's not just an art gallery but a most beautiful peaceful place that visitors to Bali can absorb the culture through workshops in dance, music, woodcarving and many other crafts traditional to Bali. It is a garden of rice paddies and statues and flowers and trees set up by Agung Rai and his family. By his success in his projects he is helping other Balinese artists to get their work recognised. If you are lucky you might even meet the man himself in one of the cafes in the complex.

Fantastic atmosphere - art not so interesting. Go here, to experience a fantastic garden. The surroundings of the museum are THE thing to enjoy, when visiting ARMA. We found the art a little borring, but enjoyed walking around and view the buildings, trees, sculptures, rice fields etc. It was also very nice, that you get a free coffee/tea included in the price, to enjoy in their restaurant. My girlfriend and I both went for a ice coffee - it was brilliant. The best in Bali so far!Worth mentioning is also, that we didn't meet many tourists. Only around 5-10.

Nice, but can be made more engaging. While this museum is very well maintained and has a lot of local culture under one roof, I would say that I have been to much better museums and I expected to learn much more about the local art and culture than i ended up learning. They could use more multi media to make it more engaging and educational. I did like the modern art section a lot especially the paddy field life sized paintings. The cafe is so-so.
Loved the grounds. We went twice to this museum as we were very impressed with the philosophy behind it. Lovely staff and little cafe. Interesting cultural items held there

Art and Atmosphere. Large grounds contain this museum, a hub for Ubud arts, a resort and two restaurants and a coffee shop. We asked our driver to pick us up in an hour and a half, and wished we had said four. The main exhibit building houses most of the collection. Another, smaller one, contains modern Balinese art including some from foreigners who chose to live here. The buildings are grand, set amidst mature landscape. The price of admission comes with a coupon for a coffee or a tea. Queen Elizabeth from England was here once upon a time for what that's worth. Balinese dance lessons were being given to children in the entry hall when we were there. There's also oodles of art classes for adults. Truly a center for the arts with the August jazz festival. Looks like excess parking available in the front walled in area--unusual for Ubud.

Beautiful. Collection is not the strongest asset of this museum; I think the collection at Puri Lukisan is more complete. However is the layout what makes this place special. It even has a rice field and a water garden. Lovely.

Beautiful place. The place is amazing ! The trees, plants, orchids, scenery and the lakes,stream and nature are spectacular! The Museum is ok, the Balinese painting are beautiful and some of them very antique;also the rice fields are very nice. I really recommended.

Unique Paintings. It is a suburb of Ubud just few minutes walking from Monkey Forest. It has plenty collection for unique paintings. When my visit there were only few visitors so we could take our time more. Nice ground and architecture. There is café available which prepare delicious food.

Just lovely. One of my favorite experiences. This museum was just amazing and I loved the combination of ancient as well as modern art. I happened to visit the museum while they were preparing for the jazz fest, so I had the extra bonus of hearing bands rehearse at various places around the property, which only added to the great vibe. Don't miss this place.

Really special setting . Whilst many people will note the art that's on display at ARMA, I think the most artistic thing about it is the setting itself. The museum is housed in a huge garden that in itself a piece of art - filled with orchids, trees, rice fields, water features, koi fishes, and ornate carvings and structures. The setting is peaceful, airy and slightly spiritual. Certainly worth a visit, even if you're not into art itself.

Worth a visit. Enjoyed our visit here. The grounds are beautiful and it was lovely to wonder through them. The collection was interesting with both modern and tradition sections, that provide greater insight into Balinese art. The collection owner Mr Agung Rai was outside the modern gallery and was happy to share the history of the collection and integrating it and the buildings with the garden, as a form of art. Entrance fee of $8 includes free coffee/tea in the lovely little coffee shop. They also have a Thai restaurant on the grounds which we didn't get to try this time but it has good reviews so will try next time.

Some very old pieces in good condition . We spent an hour or so here. The gardens are nice. The first hall had modern art work. The second hall had older art. There were some amazing paintings. Entrance fee gets you a voucher for free coffee or tea from the cafe.

Not to be missed!. I really enjoyed the time at ARMA museum, I wish to stay longer, it is not only about the painting, everything is art. Mr Agung Rai was there at the entrance just showing the way to the museum, I was very impressed to meet and even chat with a man of such vision, so humble and if you don't read the booklet you might thing he is just a staff of the place. He is an inspiration. There are beautiful gardens inside, a, nice cafe and two building with paintings, One more of balinese art ( chronological relating to materials, techniques, time) and other with more modern art but also with art work of Indonesian artists. The plants in the garden are also medicinal, it is a place to relax and enjoy not to hurry.

Nice garden of Yoga classes. We have been invited in the gardens for a yoga class. it was the opportunity to visit the place. Great gardens and lakes.
We can't judge the museum as we didn't visit inside.

Beautiful place to spend some time in Bali.. My girlfriend and I visited at the end of June 2016. The area was beautiful inside and out. Many different flowers, trees and sights to see. Both the modern and traditional sections of the museum were very well maintained, and the paintings and art inside really captured us. There was even a piece from New Westminster, BC in the modern area (try and find it)! Overall, a great experience well worth the time and money. You can't take photos so be aware of that but the memories will travel with you once you leave.

Visit to Gallery and lunch at restaurant. Delightful garden setting for gallery, restaurant and cafe.We chose to eat Balinese food in the restaurant before walking through gardens filled with orchids, though not in flower at this time.The art in Galleries worth a visit as some very beautiful work, in wood and paintings, old and modern.

Incredibly rich in history and art.. I was advised to see this place by a friend who has been to Bali over 20 times. This place did not disappoint. We did not stay in their cottages as they were quite pricey. The level of luxury is equivalent to places like Amandari and the setting for the cottages is lush.  We did see all the museums in the lovely park like setting. Someone was playing a traditional Balinese instrument while we were sightseeing. The restaurant served very nice coffee and tea and the gift shop was amazing. Even more amazing were the numerous paintings and artwork-- Walter Spies, I Gusti Nyoman Lempad, just to name a few. We are talking about millions of dollars worth of art. What a feast for the visual sense. A must see in Ubud!!!
Lovely taste of Balinese Art and Architecture. Spent an afternoon here. Nice collection. I enjoyed just walking around, looking at the architecture and enjoying a cool drink in the cafe.
Lovely. Great environs for an art gallery and great buildings for the displays. 80000 admission included coffee and treat in the stylish coffee bar. Spot on.
Frankly, boring. . Poorly maintained compound. IDR 80,000 per person which isn't cheap for Bali. Avoid unless you are really into art, of which there isn't a lot on show here anyhow.

interesting local art and carvings.. The museum, just along the road from Ubud palace has a good collection of local wood carving and art. It is a bit spread out with lots of stairs, but interesting for the local historical aspect as well.
nice. nice place in ubud , we going there with my friends , good place to look art, you must goingt there ,
Please visit. This is a quiet oasis in the heart of the town. Lovely gardens & little cafe for a cold drink. The museum is wonderful, we spent hours here

Beautiful and huge facility ... Love to see !. I really appreciate to the owner of this art museum where he really loves a wisdom of Balinese culture that is poured in the form of preservation of valuable paintings, bali dance performance and performing arts education for children in BaliBut unfortunately, not many Indonesian prefer activities like this, (visit the museum), when I visited this museum we was the only indonesian who visited this beautiful place.Salut Pak Agung Rai for what you have and present for Bali !

Interesting museum with a good collection of traditional and modern art.. Personally thought it was one of the better museum's in Ubud. Well maintained and interesting collection. Nice Thai (yes Thai...) restaurant at the other end of the museum surrounded by rice paddies (part of the hotel complex).

Beautiful. Love the ARMA..and love what Agung Rai has done to preserve the Balinese culture. His vision is amazing. The museum has some beautiful art and the grounds are beautiful! We were blessed to have met him and had the honor of sending some time with him.

Worth the money just to get away from the busy streets of Ubud. I enjoyed this visit. There are only 3 buildings with art work and it is not as impressive as the Neka museum but the Arma is part of a nice resort with serene grounds and you have a choice of 3 different cafes that you can enjoy your complimentary drink at. I chose the Thai restaurant and had the place to myself which was lovely. They encourage you to look around the hotel grounds which includes some nice rice paddies and beautiful gardens. The art work in itself isn't a great collection but the peace and quiet it comes with is oustanding.

Museum visit. Looking forward to visit some of the use us in Ubuntu as it is described as the cultural city. We did not enjoy this museum. There is not a lot of wood carving mainly pictures with little explanation. We would not go back and the price is also 85000rph per person. I think this could be better spent somewhere else.
Peaceful. Beautiful grounds and setting. Not to far to walk from Monkey Forrest. A nice peaceful place to spend a few hours. It was nice to be able to view some of Walter Spiers work.

Best one I've been too. Best museum in the area that I have been too mainly because it has lots of gardens to walk around where as the others have little gardens. We spent a fair few hours here , you get a free drink with entry and the cafe over looks a rice paddy which was lovely to see. The art inside was interesting similar to other museums in the area but it was the gardens that I really liked
worth visiting. excellent area, huge and clean. there is a balinese dancing class offered every day. there is a shortcut at the back to down to the paddy field,

Loved it!. We really enjoyed the art collection at ARMA and the surroundings were absolutely beautiful! If you want to make your money's worth, allocate at least Half a day to a Full day to hang out and chill there. NOTE: There is a 80K IDR entry fee (pretty hefty compared to other places). Comes with a free drink though :Pps. Our taxi driver was actually quite reluctant to take us there. He said the place is owned by a very rich man and I guess he wanted us to support other entities in the area. The entry ticket says the money goes to an Artists' fund but we couldn't ascertain that for sure.

Many class to participate. This place they have many class for you to learning Bali traditional, for the example, wood carving, Balinese dancing, traditional music course or batik painting. I spent a whole day here took the wood carving class which really inspired and interesting.
Loved this museum. This gallery had a fascinating collection, the modern works were more interesting than other museums in the area, all in a beautiful garden with a good cafe

Nice if you are in Ubud. We decided to spend a day in Ubud and this was on top of our list. The museum (which also has a restaurant, a cafe and a hotel) is very well kept and it has some nice art pieces of different times, styles and types, all of them related to Balinese culture. The gardens, statues and buildings were the highlight of the visit. The ticket (80'000idr) includes a complimentary drink at their cafe which is very pleasant.If you are planning to drive here like we did (motorbike), make sure to come very early. The road gets full of buses and the cars passing them by can be dangerous when they invade the other lane.

Peaceful time with OUT the hordes. Today, May 16th, I visit Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA). The owner “recognizes me” as I cane in. Really? I've never been here before. Later, after strolling around for awhile, he & I have coffee & talk a bit. I think he does this a lot. Ambling around for 3 hours; it's a nice place with lots of art & pretty landscaping among the museum, grounds & cottages. Not too many people are visiting. Maybe with the price of admission at RP 80,000 has something to do with that? For me it was fine; few people & quiet.

Beautiful museum!!. I went there during my trip to Bali, and this place did not disappoint me!! The expositions were interesting, and the museum has a nice fountain surrounded by beautiful trees. When I was there one local was playing the typical balinese music instrument, so it made my visit much nicer!

beautiful grounds...not much art. if nothing else, this is a pretty place to walk around in the heat of the day. the property is forested with many trees, lot's of sculpture and gorgeous buildings...but the art part was boring, to say the least...just some contempory painting and not all that inspiring. but go for the enviroment!
Awesome Museum. I learned so much about art and Balinese culture here. The gardens and buildings are so impressive and detailed.

Great art collection. this is the most excellent place for art lover. The painting itself were influenced by western style a little bit. Agung Rai as the name ARMA is really humble person and able to interact with visitor. Don’t be shy to talk more with him asking about Balinese history, culture and local young generation.!

Lovely grounds. Enjoy seeing art but not an art connoisseur. However the grounds of the museum were lovely. So serene and peaceful; a hidden gem amidst the hustle and bustle of Ubud city. Sit in the cafe on the lake side and enjoy a drink or lunch.

The Art. Excellent the way a foreigner travels to Ubud and discovers the creative soul of this place. Encouraging artists, creative people and fantastic paintings to admire and appreciate. Together with their humble king managed to put Ubud on the world map. You will have to see the paintings to learn about the mind of the artists. I was lucky to have met a young artist who explained his piece. Working 4 hours from 10am-2pm to capture the light, working fast with his impressionist works.

Interesting and remote. I find this museum a bit hard to find at first! However, once inside it appears to be in a completely different world. It is very peaceful and quiet here, away from the hustle and bustle of the streets and the dust and everything else. There are a number of building in the compound and the map they provide is quite handy (otherwise you may get lost here). Exhibits are quite spread out which I think gives them space to breathe compared to many other galleries or museums. Art is everywhere in Bali but this place gives us a different aspect to it, mainly the paintings.If you have some time to explore, this place is well recommended.Your ticket to the museum also includes a drink at their restaurant which is at the other side of the property but is in a VERY nice location. I loved it so much that I wish I stayed here...

Sweet museum. Great pieces from local artist. Worth it.. We really enjoyed the museum. The architecture is gorgeous and the art work is varied and interesting. Its a small museum so doable with kids. Definitely walk the grounds after or before and plan to take in lunch or dinner at the restaurant (great wife).

A perfect blend oft nature and arts. If you are already overwhelmed by the incredibly impressive landscapes and beaches oft Bali, you should not miss to visit the Agung Rai Museum oft Art (ARMA) in Ubud, Bali. Embedded in a beautiful park, you will discover a comprehensive collection oft Balinese Art and witness performances of the famous Balinese dances accompanied by the original Bali gamelang music. An absolute just for admirers oft a perfect synthesis oft the arts.

Beautiful. ARMA has such a lovely outside area with much to look at prior to even seeing the art. But the art itself is fantastic and interesting. If you're into art, definitely check out some of the Balinese works around.

More than just art. My husband and I enjoyed our visit here. There is a wide selection of Art through 3 different buildings. We are not art lovers, but enjoyed the walk around. The cafe along side the rice field is quite nice, and you can get a free drink here as part of your entrance fee. The Resort itself which is alongside, is also worth a walk through if you are not staying as it is in a nice setting.

some nice art, beautiful grounds. the buildings are big and spacious with a few interesting art pieces. I actually felt that the grounds were better than the art. The building is nice from outside and the garden is field with beautiful little sculptures and interesting plant, we were here in April and the garden as well as the museum was practically empty, you can spent a whole day relaxing in these beautiful grounds.

Boring Museum. I dropped by as it was near where I stayed but it was pretty boring and empty, I only bumped into 4 person while I was inside. Mainly works of art and many art displays. Good rainy day activity.
interesting Gallery, great grounds. We spent the afternoon here not only browsing the paintings and artwork but also exploring the grounds.the entrance ticket also includes a drink at the cafe
Gorgeous gallery and gardens. We spent a morning here - expansive museum, stunning art, beautiful grounds, lovely coffee, very informative - would highly recommend a visit here.

Would have loved to have spent longer :(. We dropped in determined to have a really good look around, especially the 'traditional' gallery. However, being 'that' time of the year it was very humid (can't be avoided) and we both found it so stifling and couldn't believe that the lovely huge windows weren't opened to assist ventilation, there was no sign of rain at all :( Enjoyed very much what we did see but wished we could have lasted longer and seen more. Just managed to escape to the coolness, refreshing Bintang and delicious pizza of the A/C at Pizza Bagus. Must visit again later in the year ;)
Nice museum. I enjoyed my trip to the Angung Rai Museum. I had the place almost for myself. The different types of art make that everybody can find something that they like.

Peace, Art, and Jungle. This is a lovely museum, set in the jungle, adjacent to rice paddies. Art is not crammed, willy nilly, and while the palatial buildings are not air conditioned, they remained cool enough while we were there. For the first time, I found the modern art more enticing that that in the building set aside for earlier pieces.Be sure to relax and enjoy your free drink at the cafeteria pavilion. We lounged on pillows, utilized the free wi-fi, and were quite refreshed before leaving.

Cultural and Soothing Ambience. It was soothing to be here. Calm. Clean. and Green. The paintings are really good. I really love it. This is for all range of ages, so you can bring your children here.

amazing, peaceful getaway. even for a non-art person like me, I enjoyed the serenity of the place. looking at the paintings, you can understand the history of Bali. they do have a cafe, where we claimed our free coffee/tea that came with the entrance ticket.for art lovers, plan at least 2 hrs here.

Come for the serenity. The art in this museum is located in two buildings. I enjoyed the old art and learned a few cultural tidbits thanks to reading the placards. But the real treat was exploring the vast grounds and beautiful greenery behind the main museum complex. The serene environment is very relaxing and peaceful.By the way, haven't verified this personally, but an expat told me that the dances hosted here are not as authentic but commercial (as opposed to the for-tourists but performed by a village ones you find everywhere else in Ubud).

A pleasant place for 1-2 hours. I came here after reading some of the reviews.You get a cup of coffee or tea included in the price, and a chance to relax in the café.The setting is very tranquil and it is quite peaceful. You can peruse the artwork at your leisure and rest as required.Not a must see, but certainly pleasant.
Good collection. Good collection of art depicting balinese way of life and culture .both old and modern take. Also free demonstration of wood carving and palm leaf painting

Culture. Walking around looking for something to do, happened to stumble across the Rai Museum, they had old and new art, it was great.The area is huge, has a nice Cafe and a comfortable restaurant.Spent quite a few hours there and also returned to the restaurant a couple of days later.

The time flew by in the most relaxing way. I'm one of those people who doesn't know art but I know what I like. I like ARMA.The grounds are beautiful and shade is plentiful as you explore the streams, rice paddy and interesting botanical specimens. It's a great place to take photos or just to sit and relax with a book (if I'd known I would have taken one and spent longer).The welcome drink is full-size and the service at the coffee shop is discreet with no pressure to order more if you don't want to. If, like us, you're around at the same time as Agung Rai himself, don't be surprised if he comes over to say hello.The Art is really, really interesting. I was captivated by the traditional Balinese art and found the modern art interesting too. Everyone mentions the golden rice field painting; it is certainly remarkable.We spent three hours here. Totally unexpected given our knowledge and experience with art.I'm going back with my book, they may not get me to leave.
Beautiful grounds, lovely artworks. I went early in the morning to avoid the crowds and it was so peaceful wandering around the artwork and grounds, so peaceful.

An great museum with amazing art, architecture, and grounds.. This was a wonderful place to spend a few hours in Ubud. The art collection depicted the Indonesian culture and talent of local artists, both old and new. The media variety was impressive.
Beautiful property, amazing art. Something for every art lover. Beautiful grounds to walk around. this a place to take your time and stroll.

Some nice art and grounds. There are 2 museums here and I found the classical one, better.
The cafe which provides the included drink is nice, but kinda pricey.

All about Balienese painting. If you want to know something about Balinese culture, you go to ARMA. nice place, 2 buildings (not marked so clearly, so you can get to the modern collection before the classical); will show you cut through Balinese history, including locally-famous Walter Spies. Tea or coffee included in the ticket price.

What a peaceful place in Ubud!. As i travel with my parents so i wanted to go somewhere in the center with walking distance. So i found this place ARMA art museum. And i have to say this visit lightening up my stay in Ubud. We spent whole morning there walk around. With morden art museum and traditional art museum, then the ground itself is just peaceful. With nice garden and cafe. The most delightful moment is I met Mr Agung Rai himself and we had very nice conversation! Learned a lot from him regarding Bali cultural. And thinking of life. I respect him as an artist with good heart. Thank you Mr Agung Rai. Next time i come back to Bali will come here again. Shirley from China.

Interesting to visit. An interesting collection of art and culture in a nice shady spot in Ubud. Several different rooms to explore and the odd exhibition to check out too. Worth a visit if you enjoy galleries.

The pick of Ubud's art museums. If you can't be bothered to visit all of Ubud's galleries, make this your only stop. The grounds are wonderful, but the art really is world class.Some of the pieces here are absolutely breath taking and if they had prints for sale I would have bought up big time. Make sure to take a close up look at 'golden corn fields' in the traditional art building - mind boggling!You get a free drink with your ticket price (60k) and also a discount at the cafe or restaurant.

Stunning!. I just took a stroll for a few hours, nearly had the museum to myself. It is really a stunning collection, not just art, but gardens and architecture. As I am an ubud visitor who comes here 3-4 times a year, i never made it here until now. I can honestly say it rightfully deserves to be in the top 5 things to do in ubud. If you are an art lover this would be your number 1.

A place like no other. We have stayed at the resort twice in three years and it just keeps getting better and better. The accommodation, restaurants and gardens are superb. The art museums are something that should never be missed even if you are not really interested in art and culture. The amazing works that are housed in the two galleries are a delight to the eye and the description of the pieces makes it a very relevant and learning experience. Recently there was a wonderful displace of water colours by Balinese and Indonesian artists and it was just so wonderful to stroll through and experience the lovely art. As guests we took the opportunity to visit the exhibition at night and it was a really lovely experience. It was quiet and the art was well lit so we could just take our time and wander through.Overall I would rate the ARMA are the best place I have ever stayed in. I would highly recommend the museum and the resort as a destination of choice for an amazing experience.
Lovely gardens, good overview of Balinese arts. We came upon ARMA by mistake but throughly enjoyed the visit. More at Thai restaurant as well. Beautiful grounds.

Lovely grounds. One of the nicer museums to walk through. Much easier access than others, still there are plenty of stairs to be navigated. However there is plenty to see and enjoy for the older family members without having to walk too far.

Beautiful space to wander. Having 2 distinct spaces for traditional and modern art is wonderful. I loved the detailed descriptions alongside most of the traditionally styled pieces. Particular favorites were the intricate batik textiles near the back of the gallery before you head upstairs. Balinese art at it's best is shown here. Being able to wander the peaceful grounds and enjoy an iced coffee looking over green rice fields just caps it all off perfectly.

Balinese Art at it's best.. A peaceful and rewarding place to see many wonderful paintings and sculptures. However if you get a chance to talk with the owner Agung Rai you will learn how to view the world from a different perspective.Creativity is to him a necessary part of ones existence. Everyone has their creative gifts and painting and sculpture are only a few of the ways those gifts are shared with us and the gods.

Absolutly wonderful museum, don't miss it, the grounds and art collection need several hours to appreciate. A blissful place, worth taking your time to enjoy. The gardens and history of the place are as inspiring as the collections, and the importance of this museum to the community and culture must be experienced first hand. five star!!

Art within tranquil setting.. ARMA has both modern and contemporary art on display held within two different buildings. Spend the extra time walking around the beautiful grounds then enjoy a refreshing free complimentary drink.

Agung is the man!. I walked into the museum grounds and within a few minutes, an older gentleman asked if I would like to join him for coffee. I accepted his invitation and quickly realized that it was Agung Rai himself. We chatted for about a half hour about his life, family, and how he developed the museum and landscapes. He is a very kind and intelligent man.As for the museum itself, the grounds are beautiful and the museum buildings are quite nice. There is a enough art to see and pathways to walk through that you can easily spend 2-3 hours there. Agung told me that the entire compound is 60,000 square meters. It is big enough to get lost in.
wonderful collection of balinese art. Brilliant collection of balinese traditional and contemporary art nestled in a beautiful tropical garden arma museum is a must see for pure art lovers..

Agung Rai is amazing. Beautiful place to spend a few hours, if you go early in the morning you might happen.upon the man himself, he is delightful and will happily have a beer and a chat. Well worth visiting and also helps underprivileged kids learn skills and cultural heritage to carry into the future.

Art of all ages. The owner and curator of this museum/gallery/hotel takes a great interest in his customers and their viewing of his collection. He has the greatest number of Indonesian Dutch art in Ubud. They hang withn and without and the halls and corridors are a work of art in themselves. A definite must visit if you want to see how local artists were influenced by artiist from abroad.

Must See Museum. A fantastic museum/gallery which has some beautiful Indonesian paintings, contemporary and traditional. The grounds are great too, lots of greenery, river, rice fields and two coffee shops where you receive a complimentary drink with a purchased ticket. Agung Rai himself is there to talk to visitors, he even drew a self portrait for me to keep. Dont miss the chance to speak to him. On Sundays they hold life drawing classes, something i'm going to do next time i visit. The museum is quite far from centre, its walkable but i would advise to take a taxi. A must see.

Spectacular art museum and botanical grounds. A must if you are interested in a great representation of art in Bali.The grounds were amazing as well all orchids,plants and trees were identified with botanical names . Very peaceful energy and also had a chance to see a woodworker hand carving trim for a temple there. It's a sacred space amidst the hubbub of ubud.

Delightful Art Museum Complex. The Agung Rai Museum of Art is a jewel in Pengosekan, a suburb of Ubud, Bali. Agung Rai started out selling paintings in Kuta Beach some decades ago. He represented artists with a sales percentage in order that he could occasionally choose a painting to keep for his own collection. The Agung Rai Museum of Art houses this collection and now much more. Dance classes are held for the local children of Pengosekan to be sure they will feel it is their own museum, not just for the tourists. The grounds are beautiful and the architecture is very nice. There's a 'Cafe ARMA' serving delicious food adjacent to the actual Museum. Sometimes you can find a painter in 'plein air' creating on a garden terrace. Full moon music and dance programs can be amazing here. Don't miss the ARMA when you are in Bali!

A small museum interesting to see. Paintings are very unique to learn the culture. There are very few visitors so you can take your time. And it's a small museum of two building. If you quickly move, it'll take less than an hour.It's about 20-30 min walk away from the entrance of the monkey forest. If you come from the Ubud palace, you'd better get a cab.

fantastic place. Stunning setting in parks and jungle. great collection of historic balinese artworks by western artists living in bali and famous balinese artists. Architecture resembles a palace with walkways and waterways and gardens. Sunday mornings you can watch children practicing legong dance in the main hall. A high class Thai restaurant and a comfortable warung coffee are on the grounds. The owner Agung Rai is a friendly and humble guy, full of stories and information. portrait drawing classes on sunday morning in the garden.
Love the Art. I was visiting the Arma last year, it was nice to see lots of beautiful Balinese painting and the place was quiet good

Worth a visit. If you want to expore Balinese art easily, visit here! Surroundings were very pretty and place was very nice. Tranquil atmosphere. We spend there almost 2 hours, even thought we are not so in to art :) Entrance fee 60 000 INDR; included a free coffee.

Traditional Paintings Worth Viewing. The ARMA Museum of Art provides a great exhibition of traditional Balinese paitings as well as an insight into Balinese history - well worth the visit. The surrounding gardens are also worth a look.
Deserves a long visit. We could have stayed longer as the grounds are extensive and beautiful. We saw the traditional section to the art gallery though there were many more to see had we had the time

Definitely worth a visit. We had a lovely afternoon at ARMA - with it's interesting collection of both traditional and contemporary Balinese art all set in beautiful surroundings next to rice paddies. On a very hot day we visited the cafe was a nice spot to stop and have a nice cold drink and relax in between visiting the art. You can also meander around he adjacent resort which has very pleasant gardens - we treated ourselves to a cocktail in one of the cabanas overlooking the rice paddies - very nice!

Their philosophy makes this place a must see. Mr Agung Rai created this museum resort to ensure Balinese culture and art continues. Profits from this museum goes back into teaching Balinese children about Balinese art, dance and culture. I have stayed at the ARMA resort several times and each time I have taken courses at the museum which were interesting, I've learnt about Balinese painting, weaving, batik and wood carving techniques as well as offering making. I enjoyed them very much.By supporting this museum I feel that my tourist money is helping to conserve and continue the culture that bought me to Ubud in the first place.

Must visit . Ubud can be busy in the peak season but the ARMA is a great escape for 3 hours. It has two very interesting art galleries, a cafe, hotel and a high quality but relatively cheap restaurant amongst an amazing set of gardens and very pretty rice fields.

'Art is a way of life' - agung rai, arma founder. We were oh so lucky to bump into Agung Rai himself. He was literally just strolling the grounds with his camera.So more than a review of the grounds (they're lovely), i'd like to share the glimpse i got of the vision brought to life in this little corner in Ubud.'Art is a way of life'. So don't expect it to be about the paintings on the wall or the exhibits hanging on a hallway. It's about a holistic experience where there is beauty at every turn. Harmony between living creativity and nature's calm. We spent more time than we intended to in arma. Jusy keep walking where your eyes take you and you'll see intricate sculpted walls, lovely walkways, beautiful bridges, a rushing river below...Oh and a ticket comes with a free cup of coffee or tea. All that beauty may make you thirsty :)
Soso museum on very nice grounds. The museum was not one of the best I ever visited but the grounds with all the detail made for a nice walk
Really cool . Definitely worth checking out. Some pretty amazing and also crazy art. Works of hell etc. Cool place to walk around too
Interesting to have a museum in a resort or a resort in a museum. we loved the Thai restaurant inside the museum. Interesting only if you have interest in art and painting.

big museum of ubud nice Art collection. Arma is big museum of ubud, have a nice collection painting. beautiful garden and there you can find arma cafe, with nice food and drinks. take a rest some minute after see and enjoy the painting in museum.

Visit if you have some spare time. A really wonderful place that is worth visiting if you have an hour or so to spare. Entry came with a free drink at the cafe. Lots of priceless paintings to be seen. I was feeling really ill from food poisoning the night before so had to leave pretty much immediately after I got there - however from the few artworks I did manage to see I definitely felt enriched from the experience. Definitely recommend out of all of the art places in Ubud as its much less commercialised. It wasn't crowded at all and so it was nice to peacefully be able to look at artworks by yourself or your group for as long as you like without other people bothering you. They also put on authentic performances at night with the option of dinner - and this is at a price comparable to the Ubud Palace performances. So it might be worth considering this instead if you would like to avoid gimmicky tourist crowds.

Tranquility next to the bustle of Ubud. This space was so peaceful and quiet with very few tourists when we went through. It is a large garden that includes art gallery pavilions and a great little cafe. You can even wonder through the resort that is next to the precinct which has a jungle feel to it because of the flowing water feature.

Felt like an Art Explorer. The art is displayed within the beautiful traditional buildings within the ARMA complex, which is also a lovely resort. I recognize many of the artists since I'm familiar with SE Asian artist since I live in Singapore. For the price of the entrance of 60K, you can take a coffee or tea in one of the 3 restaurants in the premises. I was lucky that the gamelan band was practicing for the evening dance performance so I had musical accompaniment for my entire 2 hour visit. Most people will be done in probably an hour. I was all alone roaming about the buildings that housed a great collection of art from Indonesian artists and also some foreign resident-artists. The artwork is mainly in 2 large buildings. But I also wandered around the gardens and in the right season, there are still rice paddies surrounding the resort. Definitely nice to explore inside and outside. And probably worthwhile to come and see one of the various nightly dance performances. Oh they even give you souvenir booklet about ARMA which is quite informative.

Exceeded Expectation. My partner and I went to visit this pace without expecting too much however we were pleasantly surprised and glad that we did. There are some really nice paintings and also learnt some history from visiting this place.

Worth a visit if you have time on your side. If not, you're not missing out on much. Beautiful gardens, and the museum gives a good overview of Balinese art over time (I preferred the gallery dispalying the more modern of the artwork). Included in the admission cost is a mini booklet that would be worth reading before visiting the galleries. Just find a bench in the garden, admire the surroundings and spend 10 minutes reading up on the museum and it will at least make the gallery visits a bit more interesting. I wouldn't say it's worth squeezing ARMA into your itinerary if you're pushed for time in Ubud.
Loved it!. So peaceful and beautifully set out. One mans dreamed shared with many. Although the art gallery itself wasn't really my cup of tea, the artistry in the garden design was lovely.

Enjoyed learning about Bali's history through art.... Enjoyed learning about Bali's history through art. The owner's superior sense of aesthetics prevails both through the resort and museum. Pictures were not allowed hence missing
Nice place to see balinese culture. providing so many culture performances, like dance, paint, and musics. I love to be in ARMA. I hope i can go to that place again

Worth a visit. Nice museum set in lovely gardens. Some interesting traditional Balianese art on the first floor. The modern art wasn't really my taste though. Lovely gardens. The entrance fee includes a cold drink in the pretty cafe.

A must to visit in Ubud. As a frequent visitor to Ubud and second visit to the Arma Museum did not disappoint. Very quiet with the peaceful bequtuful gardens and many species have been identified for you. A visit this time with my sisters confirmed this site as a must to visit. Art galleries were beautifully kept to house some amazing and some very old artworks, along with modern artwork. After several hours in the galleries you can eat at the on site restaurant, or quietly explore the gardens of the Arma, with rivers, bridges, ponds, statues and rice field views its just wonderful. We had coffee at the Cafe/Thai restUrant on site and all sat in quiet bliss having enjoyed our visit.

very large place. for piecefull living in ubud i choose ARMA.. i have great experience when my teacher take me to learning in an outdoor setting she take me to ARMA museum.. oh what a great museum.. so many world class painting.. perfect..

Interesting pieces of art and garden. Entrance fee is 60 000 and way worth it. There are very interesting pieces of art and a beautiful garden. You will see modern, local, historical ... Tickets come with a free drinks. We had an delicious ice tea served with coconut pancakes.

Interested in learning the art and history of Bali?. Agung Rai is located on a beautiful compound. It includes restaurants and spa in addition to the museum. Enjoy a cool drink or dine at the gardenside restaurants. Then walk over to the museums that host both historical and contemporary works of art. The museum provides a survey of the art of Bali. It's well worth spending the day enjoying the unique compound dedicated to the culture of Bali.

Very impressive art collection and gorgeous grounds. We spent an afternoon at ARMA and were very impressed with the art collection and the beautiful grounds and gardens. we enjoyed being on the property so much we are considering staying at the guesthouse on out next visit..highly recommended

Worth a visit. Lovely building and gardens. Costs 60000 Entry fee, and you get a free drink in the cafe included, which is a nice touch. Interesting selection of art, and worth a visit if you are interested in seeing a good selection. They also have dancing performances most evenings, starting at 7 or 7.30 depending on the day of the week, and the full moon.
proud to be indonesian cause of this place. the art was incredible, the atmosphere as well. it shows a lot of art from various places around the world. bagus bagus banget asli

There is a beautiful garden & rice field!. The museum has a beautiful garden!! I went there alone,and appreciated many pictures.The ticket is Rp60,000,including 1 drink.We can drink a cup of coffee or tea.So I could drink coffee while enjoying a beautiful rice terrace view.
Balinese art collection. If you love art and have a great interest in art, then you will find ARMA an interesting place. Interesting curation in what was once a family home (I believe).

Take an hour or two. This is a great museum in the main road at Ubud. There are a number of building with paintings, sculptor and woven art works. Some of these are very old and also old photos showing life as it once was. Very peaceful and quiet and easy to spend a few hours here. Photos are allowed but NO FLASH please. There is also a little cafe for a quiet break
WOrth visting. This is the best museum in Ubud. 60k to get in, plus a free coffe in their lovely cafe and a discount in the resto. VERY intersting picuuteres - much bettter than in the Blanco Musem
Impressive museum. Visited this beautiful museum which is superb both from the facilities and from the exhibition point of view. Just loved it!

Wonderful experience . I'm an art lover so I decided to visit arma to see the paintings. They certainly didn't disappoint! Lovely pieces on display. Mr agung rai himself stood outside the building welcoming and directing people. He was so kind and friendly but I mistook him for the usher hehe and even told him in the face, "I think Mr agung rai must be very rich." he said, "oh!" in surprise. Palm face. At his direction, I had a nice coffee, saw lovely artwork n walked about the beautiful grounds. Beautiful landscaping I like this museum best. More than neka cos d grounds r so nice. I plan to go back to enrol in some of their workshops. :)

Very interesting museum. the good thing about this museum is that they mix contemporary art with ancient. they have various expositions in different spaces, also they have a small store where they sell amazing books about history of art, photography, etc. I had an amazing time and after the tour we stopped by the restaurant near the resort and had coffee and ice tea on the house :)

Magnificent gardens and art exhibitions. The Agung Rai gardens are an oasis of calm and beauty in the middle of otherwise busy streets of Ubud. We enjoyed the traditional art exhibition as well as the modern paintings all presented in beautiful buildings.The entry fees are affordable and the free beverage was greatly appreciated.

super Art Museum with Bali & German history on paintings. Very nice location with lovely garden and Museum with several paintings or Art from balinese or German (W. Spies) in the past. You can see a lot of nice paintings there

outstanding display of Balinese art. One of the outstanding art museums in Bali is the Agung Rai Museum of art. Life size,Balinese paintings, cultural depictions of daily activity, female forms, historical mileau,and contemporary art make this place a must see in Bali.Outstanding historical gates, a hotel with modern amenities in natural surroundings with paddy fields in view,a restaurant and a hall holding dance shows makes this a complete package for all art lovers and tourists who want to have the ethnic feel of Bali.If lucky, one is greeted by the great artist, Mr Agung Rai himself who explains all things to see and do with a smiling face.

Paradise on earth!. This is a lovely must-see museum, mainly for its amazing landscape and well maintained gardens and water features. It is like walking through paradise! Fruit trees abundant with ripe fruits and many areas where you can relax and absorb the nature and nature sounds. The museum is lovely too with some gorgeous artwork. Very clean and airy space. Well worth a visit.

beautiful museum. Good collection art.The space is absolutely beautiful and magical.The owner/founder walks around ensuring that everyone gets the most out of the experience. Stop by the ARMA cafe for a delicious lunch

Very nice museum. This is a small museum, but with a lot of interesting pieces, not overly crowded, in a lovely garden. It's located in Ubud, walking distance to many stores, hotels and spas. I recommend visiting it.

Simply Gorgeous. It has been almost a month since our visit to ARMA and not a day has passed that I haven't reflected on this beautiful place. I have told many people of the positive impact this magnificent Museum and Gallery has had on us.If you have any interest in art or just want to enjoy the tranquil grounds then please treat yourself to a visit.Like a previous review from Jean we also had the pleasure of encountering the delightful owner Agung Rai. What a wonderful human being. I feel privileged and enriched to have spent just a few minutes in his company. We went to thank him when we were leaving but he was having a nap in his stunning garden. So thank you Agung Rai. The world could benefit from more people like you.The Buildings, the Gardens, the Art and the Resort are a credit to all involved and I certainly recommend a visit. A must when in Ubud. I would love to return.

A cultural feast. This is my first ever Tripadvisor review. Agung Rai himself asked us to place a comment on the webpage if we had enjoyed our visit. We did not know at the time that the kind and knowledgeable man who showed us hidden corners of the garden was in fact the founder of ARMA. We had spent delightful time in the beautiful buildings looking at the extensive and well labelled (in English) art of Bali, which alone is worth the entrance fee. We had enjoyed our free drink in the relaxing cafe and were starting to wander the gardens to the rice fields and village when we met Agung Rai. He pointed out animals and birds and fish woven in stone into the fabric of walls, told how money from the resort funds the foundation and enriched an already wonderful visit. Thankyou, Agung Rai and ARMA. If you make only one cultural visit in Ubud, consider making it this one.

Must visit Balinese museum. This is private museum. The ticket is quite expensive but it included compliment drink and worth to go. We love the mission of the owner here. After visit museum, you can follow the trail to rice field and balinese village. Highly recommended.

Nice !. Lots of nice paintings, dance performance in some evenings, cafe on the premises. Very relaxing but in central Ubud. Lots of paintings by first european travellers to Bali. Nice architecture of the building.

This is a wonderful place for dinner.. High on the hill overlooking the rain forest ,and the street below, the outlook is very pretty,lush tropical gardens and Balinese designed surroundings. The staff are well trained and food is very well presented .We will be returning .

Nice Balinese museum in Ubud. Easily accessible, just a short stroll south from the main touristy area, the museum has few nice pieces and a beautiful garden with lots of orchids. The owner is from a royal Balinese family, protector and supporter of Balinese art, well known and respected both in the Balinese community and world-wide. Definitely worth the trip, you might even get a chance to have a cup of coffee and a little chat with this charismatic Balinese owner.

quiet surraunding, some amying pictures and photos. The museum, the garden and the architecture is beautiful, I am wondering why there were so less people, that was good for me. The Entry wasnt expensive and some pictures where really amzing, specially the photos. I relaxed a bit long there in the garden, but you can do just the museum in 1 to 1 and a half hour.
Museum Visit by Australian Artists. A group of 11 artists visited this lovely museum of contemporary and traditional art and enjoyed it thoroughly!

Where are all of the visitors?. This is a great Art gallery to visit in Ubud but there were hardly any other visitors when I was there. That is a real shame. The Complimentary iced coffee would cover the cost of the entry back home. Interesting art it is nice to see the development from the older traditional religious themes to the modern paintings. Nice garden setting. There were a few mozzies so maybe use repellent
Lovely building. Wonderful art.. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our morning at ARMA -- many beautiful and inspiring artworks. One of the best galleries in Bali.

Worth seeing. It is a must that you visit this Agung Rai Museum of art. There are many intricately painted work of art. Some might get a shock of their lives if they see a swastika sign in one of the paintings.

for art lovers. I think you would enjoy if you are a lover of art but not really for us. It was good to see balinese art and some history of art but we didnt stay long. I think you need to have a look because thats what a holiday is about

View all the great Artists who have painted in Bali .. I frequently bring my Guests here and would say it is the finest Art Museum in Bali . Agung Rai and his Wife are a charming knowledgeable Couple ,and he has by his hard work done well plus created something to be proud of . From the days in the Seventies when he was cycling to Kuta to sell Paintings on the Beach to now is a fantastic achievement .
Wow. Such a great mix of old ways and new ways of art in Bali.Great insight into traditional artists . Lovely gardens and workshops available too. Great cafe for a visual rest.

Definitely worth a visit. Beautiful and serene gardens, interesting and fascinating artwork. It's a great place to soak up the rich Balinese culture and heritage at your own pace. It costs IDR 60,000 to get in, well worth the money.The marker on the map is not quite accurate. However it is on the same road so you won't miss it if you keep going along following the road.
A treat to visit. Fabulous environment and art galleries - quiet, beautiful, fantastic information on the art and cultural context.

Not to be missed. This gallery was our favorite attraction in Bali. The baliness art is housed is 2 complexes set in a beautiful tropical garden that adjoins a resort. It allowed us to stroll at a leisurely pace away from the heat of the afternoon sun. We enjoyed a complementary drink in the cafe and then a delicious Thai lunch in one of the 3 gazebos. The food and juices that we ordered for 4 people totalled A$50 which was incredibly cheap for the quality and ambience. I can't recommended ARMA more highly for this overall experience.

Must-see if you like art!. This was a fantastic art gallery. The buildings and gardens were absolutely beautiful and housed a fascinating collection. One building houses Balinese art, mainly from over the last century, with interesting information available about the pieces. The other building houses expat art and Balinese art with expat influence (and vice versa). An astonishing collection and I was amazed moreover at the fact we only saw one other tourist there!

A worthwhile visit. This place showcases art work from traditional through to contemporary. Some of the scenes depicted in the traditional paintings are ghoulish and one or two pieces of the contemporary artwork are interesting- something for everyone here.Lots of information was provided at reception and the entrance fee of Rp 60,000 includes a refreshment in the small café onsite. No photographs were allowed in the gallery with the older artworks but no restriction in the newer area.Very peaceful surroundings and lovely gardens.

Its a matter of taste and interest. The best bit for me was the utterly beautiful garden filled with stunning flowers and trees. A marvellously cool environment away for the hustle and bustle of the tourist filled streets, quiet and tranquil. Also very interestingly there is a rice field along side I watched intently as the farmer tended to his cows and went about his daily business. The entrance fee is 60k which I later discovered included a complimentary drink - nobody said so I didn't take up the kind offer. You do get lovely and well constructed book not a booklet about the work of the family and the ARMA foundation.For me the least interesting was the actual museum but that's a matter of interest. Some very nice pieces so if that's your thing you're in the right place - enjoy. Difficult for those who find stairs/steps a bit of an issue no disabled access.
Interesting and educational . Definitely different. One very special large painting of the rice terraces that is not to be missed. A little oasis of solitude just off the main street- amazing!

Great museum in beautiful garden. Lovely display of paintings from Bali. Very open and easy to browse thru.The museum sits in the middle of a beautiful garden that you need to visit and enjoy. There is also a café on the site.

Agung Rai's Museum and Golden Hour Tour. For my first visit to Ubud, I had researched places to visit and the Museum of Art came up highly rated with the Golden Hour Tour also appealing strongly. Neither disappointed.The art work all but brought tears to my eyes, most of it so beautiful and touching, and the grounds and buildings were magnificent - shade, gardens, running water, a wood carver at work, signs in English. I was not staying in the accommodation (ARMA) but walked through it to access the reception area to see if I could book a Golden Hour Tour and it looked impressive indeed.I was fortunate that Agung Rai agreed to take me on the tour - yes, he took just me - so next morning I met him at 5.45am and we set off in the car. Then followed a wonderful few hours with this learned and astonishing man who showed and shared with me some of his Bali insights, knowledge and special places. We drove and walked along magnificent jungle, rice paddies and past workers and simple, uncluttered villages in the early morning light - what a privilege! Amongst so many, two highlights I could pull out for special mention were the visits to a family compound and a temple where Agung Rai patiently explained to me how families, community and rituals and traditions come together to make Bali what it is. It was a real privilege to do this tour and to meet Bak Agung Rai in this way.

Good selection of contemporary Bali Art. Displayed in nice surroundings, beautiful halls and garden, this museum shows a variety of art from the beginning of "tourism" (1930) inspiring and mixing with traditional Bali painting styles.
Okay.. Not the most interesting thing to see in Ubud. We walked through all the displays of art, nice to get out of the hot heat.

Don't miss out , Django says .. First visit the more Modern Gallery containing nearly all the Foreign Artists who have painted in Bali since the 30's , then have a Snack or lunch in the Restaurants before viewing the other Gallery . If you get a chance have a chat with Agung Rai a charming and interesting Man .
Beautiful area. The grounds of the museum are beautiful, but the museum itself is not a must see. A lot of paintings, some really beautiful. It is an ok visti if running out of things to do.

You must visit this landmark!. Very nice cafe and attentive, courteous staff that makes sure your visit is very enjoyable. The ARMA is one of the must visit spots in Ubud. With a gallery, cafe, beautiful grounds, hotel, and Thai restuarant, they are doing everything right. Highly recommend.
Balinese Art History. Only go if you are very interested in Balinese art history. It's well laid out but has little to offer the average tourist.
All round great. If you are interested in Balinese art and art history as well as some excellent contemporary exhibitions in a beautiful setting it is well worth it

An excellent way to spend time learning and participating in Balinese culture.. A fantastic place to see and participate in Balinese culture. Learn to play gamelan, dance, cook Balinese food, carve wood, paint, make batik and other interesting activities taught by very skilled and personable teachers genuinely interested in showing you the best of their cultural arts.

Peaceful . Really loved our visit to ARMA. Together with hubby we spent nearly 3 hours walking around. Is not just a museum. It's massive complex of gardens, ponds, rice fields and museum. Their exhibition is great, helps you understand Balinese culture even more. You have complimentary coffee or tea at their restaurant. Me and hubby ordered some cakes at their restaurant and must admit it was the best cake I had during my stay in Bali (I ordered Mocha Tiramisu). ARMA is must do on your attraction list.

Mr Rai, an inspiring man!. Agung Rai is a wonderful and inspiring man. Visiting this museum is a must to capture a look of bali´s past and its future and how mr Rai keeps the balance between this. If you get the chance to meer mr Rai, ask him lots of questions about culture and spirituality and just listen to this wise man!
Artistic... Great representation of art and history! Please dont go with kids though, its educational but most of the pictures are nude.

Picturesque. I wasn't really a 100% on going there. ...but when I got there, WOW! the grounds are stunning and have been really well maintained. The deeper you go into the gardens the more beautiful it gets. The Art Museum is really interesting. From traditional Balinese art to abstract. We spent a good 3 hours there from start to finish. Enjoyed an iced tea at the restaurant (which is complimentary when you purchase the ticket - 60'000 rupiah).The staff on the grounds are very friendly. We were even invited to watch children take there dance classes, which was mesmerising. They hold traditional dance performances in the evening. We went back on the same day for dinner at the Thai restaurant in the grounds which was really tasty. I would definitely recommend a visit if you want to spend an afternoon doing something at your own pace. All in all a really nice afternoon.

Very good Museum in Ubud. Ubud very populer with the art village.in ubud area there one good pleace to see art painting the name is Arma Museum.in this pleace you can to see many of painting colektion.so very nice to see.besiade of that in Arma have many even yoga and show.soo great pleace.

Peaceful and beautiful gardens. Finding this place helped restore my faith in Ubud as a beautiful, tropical, peaceful paradise. Outside this oasis Ubud has gone nuts since I last visited. I was disappointed by the traffic, pollution and rubbish. Rice paddy views are gone, but this art museum and gallery and the evening dance performance were amazing.

Music, dancers, gardens -- what more could you want?. I'm not going to rate the Museum as a whole (there are plenty of reviews for that), but just want to call readers' attention to the wonderful Sunday evening performances there, every Sunday at 7:30 p.m. For 75,000 Rp. per person, we heard wonderful Balinese gamelan musicians and saw fabulous Balinese traditional dancers for about an hour and a half. The setting is stunning, outdoors in a garden at the museum. We were fortunate to be able to walk around the gardens and go into one of the buildings to see some of the art; I don't know if the latter is always allowed, but a walk on the grounds would be quite enough to make the pre-performance time special.
Peaceful. Peacefull oasis in Ubud. beautiful grounds. Restaurant beautiful and hotel rooms fantastic. Easy walk to most points of Ubud. Close to Yoga Barn. Dr Barry

Ubud best kept secret. Quiet retreat near the busy Ubud. It is a wonder why not many people know about this place. Aside from the galleries, you get to walk thru gardens, rice field, a village and a beautiful resorts. All of this without meeting a single tourist!!!!
ARMA is just beautiful. Go there !!! This was an absolute highlight of this year's trip. Oh and eat in the main restaurant here for that grand "event" meal of your trip.

Interesting gallery with beautiful surroundings. If you enjoy contemporary paintings you should visit ARMA but even if you are not that into that it is worth a visit. The surroundings of the museum are beautiful, this is also a botanical garden, every plant has a name tag. It is also a resort with fantastic pool villas and rooms.

A good collection. Upon entry I was given a brochure and started to make my way through the lovely grounds when I passed a gentleman who started to advise me on the different parts of the museum and where I could go - which was extremely nice!After he left I looked through the brochure and discovered he was in fact the owner of the museum himself!The collection is nice with a broad range of artwork - not just Balinese but also European (including some great dutch artists).The grounds are very pretty and there is a complementary drink in the cafe area (where I happened to bump into the owner again and spent some more time chatting - a very cool guy).

Well worth a visit - quiet and very informative. Kids enjoyed it as well. A good place to go when you are after a half a day of peace and quiet. There is some nudity (which is tasteful) but this might help keep your kids entertained - a few giggles. Some of the art and pieces go back many centuries and the information available is good. The staff were also very helpful if you had any specific questions. There is a great restaurant within a few km's next to rice paddy - but unfortuately cant recall what it was called.
Nice to visit but not a must see . Very nice area. Good if you have more than one day to spend in Central Ubud, but with so many things to see like the monkey forest and Campuhan its okay to miss.
Small but nice. Small museum, in a great environment. Local paintings from the 20th century, some nice contemporary art. Beautiful, peaceful, local garden.

Not an art person but enjoyed it. I mainly enjoyed it as earlier in our trip we had seen some traditional Balinese dancing and folklore story telling. It was great to see art that told stories about the Balinese culture and more so that I could take my time reading about Balinese folklore.

Informative of the culture and gorgeous grounds. Definitely recommend ARMA if you are coming to Bali with little understanding or knowledge about the local culture.
